SENT.plain: A 4-year-old boy developed progressive neck pain and an expansile osteogenic lesion of C2; the diagnosis was an aneurysmal bone cyst
An image-guided biopsy with 3D CT planning was performed followed by Ethibloc injection into the aneurysmal bone cyst
Subsequent CT and MR images demonstrated embolization material in the vertebrobasilar system, and the patient died of brain stem and cerebellar infarction 23 hours after the intervention
The course of events and technical considerations are discussed
